means: 发誓弃绝者，正式放弃者
发誓弃绝的，正式放弃的

sentence.Network_en: The conqueror tried to make the natives abjure their religion.
sentence.Network_cn: 征服者试著让当地人宣誓放弃他们的宗教.

sentence.Network_en: They were compelled to abjure their faith.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们被迫发誓放弃自己的信仰.

sentence.Network_en: Indeed, if many investors abjure the listing , those who hold their noses and take the plunge might make even more money.
sentence.Network_cn: 当然, 如果许多投资人放弃购买该公司的股份, 那些铤而走险的人也许真的会赚更多的钱.

Some of the Roman Emperors tried to make Christians abjure their religion ., 有些罗马皇帝试著使基督教徒宣誓放弃他们的宗教.

jx.jx_en_mean: (historical)swear an oath to leave a country or realm forever

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from Latin abjurare, from ab- 'away' + jurare 'swear'

entry.tran: 发誓弃绝，郑重声明放弃(信仰、生活方式等）
entry.def: If you abjure something such as a belief or way of life, you state publicly that you will give it up or that you reject it.

example.ex: He abjured the Protestant faith and became King in 1594.
example.tran: 他放弃了新教信仰，于1594年登基为王。
表示放弃军事行动的正式声明

means.word_mean: 1. formally reject or disavow a formerly held belief, usually under pressure;

sentences.sentence: "He retracted his earlier statements about his religion"

auth_sentence.content: This rough magic I here abjure.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This rough magic I here abjure.

auth_sentence.content: Patton, after all, isn't telling girls to abjure college.
auth_sentence.res_content: Patton, after all, isn't telling girls to abjure college.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Patton, after all, isn't telling girls to abjure college.

auth_sentence.content: He also encouraged satyagrahis to feel empathy for their political opponents and to abjure violence against the British.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: He also encouraged satyagrahis to feel empathy for their political opponents and to abjure violence against the British.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 法律上的,有关权利义务的
stems_affixes.word_buile: jur发誓,法律;正确,正直+al……的→adj.法律上的,有关权利义务的
jur发誓,法律;正确,正直+y人→发誓的人→陪审团
ab离开+jure=jur发誓,法律;正确,正直→发誓离开→放弃→誓绝
con全部+jure=jur发誓,法律;正确,正直→全部发誓→恳求别人;引申为变魔术
in不+jur发誓,法律;正确,正直+e→不法行为→伤害[别人]

means.word_mean: 发誓放弃;郑重放弃(意见)，正式放弃(信仰、主张等)；宣布撤回(声明等)

sentences.en: The conqueror tried to make the natives abjure their religion.
sentences.cn: 征服者试著让当地人宣誓放弃他们的宗教。

sentences.en: Indeed, if many investors abjure the listing, those who hold their noses and take the plunge might make even more money.
sentences.cn: 当然，如果许多投资人放弃购买该公司的股份，那些铤而走险的人也许真的会赚更多的钱。
